markdown: ## GENERAL INFORMATION The American Public Health Association welcomes you to the National Conference on Food Protection. This conference represents the cooperative efforts of many dedicated individuals over a period of six years, and it is financed through a contract with the Public Health Service, Food and Drug Administration, DHEW. We also wish to acknowledge the cooperation of the U. S. Department of Agriculture, and the many cooperating universities and professional associations. **WORKSHOP SESSIONS** Each of the ten separate workshops will discuss and prepare a revision of its assigned position paper and action plan. The revisions should be completed by Tuesday at 4:30 p.m. Each workshop will have its own chairman and reporter to record the specifics of changes in position papers and action plans. Your badge number identifies your workshop assignment. All Workshops No. 1 through No. 6 are on the Mezzanine floor, and Workshops No. 7 through No. 10 are on the first level. Workshop rooms are listed on the Monday program. CONFERENCE AND PRESS HEADQUARTERS Conference press room and Conference headquarters are in Rooms 508 and 509 respectively. ## CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS The proceedings of the conference will be prepared and submitted to the U. S. Food and Drug Administration for reproduction and distribution to interested parties. 4
